lines.text: No grief for Lips?
I'm wearing black underwear.
You know, it's legal for me to take you down to the station and sweat it out of you under the lights.
I sweat a lot better in the dark.
Wait a minute! Wait. I'm having a thought. Oh, yes. Oh, yes. I'm gonna have a thought. It's coming... It's gone.
Around me, if a woman don't wear mink, she don't wear nuttin'.
Well, I look good both ways.
You get behind me, we all profit; you challenge me, we all go down! There was one Napoleon, one Washington, one me!
[Breathless pours a drink for Dick Tracy]
I'm on duty.
What's your day off?
Sunday.
It's a big world... must be Sunday somewhere.

You know, Dick - You mind if I call you "Dick"? My associates here would very much like to see you have a little accident. But I tell 'em, "No. I'll take care of Tracy myself," I tell 'em. You know why? I want you on my side!
[Itchy hands Big Boy a suitcase. Big Boy takes out of it a large wad of cash]

And let me tell you what my side is. My side is a lifetime of action and adventure with no clock to punch. It's treating that gal of yours 100%. She should be treated like a princess. Protected like a baby.
You gonna put *all* that money down there?
Fifteen thousand clams.
[Big Boy drops the money on the table. The Kid watches from the small window]
It's a deal.
[Big Boy pushes the money toward Tracy]
Fifteen thousand clams.
[Tracy takes the money. The Kid gapes in disbelief, sad and disappointed to see his hero take the bribe. Itchy chuckles]

Welcome to new waters, Dick! We're gonna run one hell of a ship with you aboard. There's a big world out there, and it's up for sale. All of it. All we gotta do is make sure that the people know I'm the one big enough to run it.

[dryly]
And that you are guilty of attempting to bribe an officer of the law.
[Tracy throws all the money back in Big Boy's face. The Kid smiles, realizing Tracy never meant to take the bribe money. The thugs grab hold of Tracy]
Hey, hey!
Not so fast, coppa.

[angrily]
You dumb dick!

[muffled pleading as the cement covers him]
Big Boy, we're friends. Big Boy, not the Bath! Not the bath! B-bath. Ahh!
I know, and I'm gonna miss you. But, all's fair in love and business. Benjamin Franklin.

Because I have a vision. A big boss must have a vision. We gotta town with thousands of small stores and businesses. People are working real hard. I think they should be working real hard. For us. Because we are for the people. "And if you ain't for the people, you can't buy the people." Lincoln.
Police brutality, boys. And this is the fifth time. Lucky for me I don't bruise easily.
Mr. Caprice, do you intend to take legal action against the city for false arrest?
Why should I blame the city for something one man is doing? This Tracy character's unstable. The city should get rid of him.
You mean if you don't get rid of him first.
Who said that?

All right, that's enough! I want 'em dead, both of 'em. I want this no-face character dead and I want Tracy dead. What's the matter, you bums forgot how to kill people? Doesn't your work mean anything to you anymore? Have you no sense of pride in what you do? No sense of DUTY, no sense of DESTINY? I'm looking for generals; what do I got? Foot soldiers! I WANT DICK TRACY DEAD!
Hello, gentlemen. Where's Lips Manlis?
Who's Lips Manlis?
Yeah, who's Lips Manlis? We get to make one phone call. That's the law.
Yeah?
Yeah. Gimme the phone.
Here's the phone. Be my guest.
[Itchy throws the phone - its line cord removed by Tracy already]
Make a note, Pat. They waived their right to a phone call.
Right, Tracy.
Hey, coppa. Maybe you wanna look before you leap, huh? We got rights.
Take the bad men away. They scare me.
Is the enemy of my enemy my friend, or the enemy of my friend my enemy?
What?
Or enemy of my enemy my enemy?
What'd he say?
The enemy of my enemy is my enemy.
He said the enemy of his enemy is his enemy.
Oh.
Thanks for calling. I was beginning to wonder what a girl had to do to get arrested.
Wearing that dress is a step in the right direction.
[repeated line]
When do we eat?
Aren't you gonna frisk me?
I know how you feel. You don't know if you want to hit me or kiss me. I get a lot of that.

Don't tell me about my boys messin' up the Tracy rub-out. They were being tested, they flunked. Now they're just flunkies, like you! I don't care if Tracy puts one and one together, don't matter to me. You're still workin' for me. You're on my side. You're not out! You're *not* out! When you are dead, then you are out! You are mine, I own you!

[after a former gangster ally's car explodes with him in it]
Very upsetting.
[Blank has Tracy and Big Boy cornered]
Whoever you are, *I know* we can make a deal.
[after Pruneface tried rationing with Big Boy about why a plan failed]
You're right. When you're right, you're right and you are right.
[after 88 Keys told Big Boy about the Blank]
What was that all about?
My income tax.

[seeing this, gets upset]
Hey!
[88 Keys turns and bolts out of the room]

[to Breathless]
Come here!
You want me to follow him?

[to Flattop]
Where? To the piano?
[to Breathless]
That was none of your business. Come here.
[pulls her into his lap and slaps her face]
*I'm* you're business.
[slaps her face again]
[Big Boy can't see where Tracy is in gear house]

[panicking]
Come on. Just lemme see ya. I just wanna see your face. I just wann- I just wanna talk some sense in- I wanna-
[angry]
I just wanna take your head and I wanna crush it like an egg!
[panics]
No, no! I didn't mean that!
[after a horrible rehearsal, 88 Keys and the singers complain that it's 2 am]
It's 2 a.m.? I'm about to turn this *dump* into the best place of a new era in entertainment, you're telling me it's 2 a.m.?
[smashes 88 Keys' fingers on the piano keys]

[yelling]
Play the piano!
Hey! That was a silly thing to do. He's the best piano player in town.
Shut up! Come here.
[88 Keys starts playing again]
Next time, I take his fingers and I turn them into pretzels. I just might do the same thing to your face.
[slaps her]
[88 Keys seems to play smoother]
See? He's playing better already.

[after finding the bug in the ceiling, whispers]
We're being bugged, we're being bugged. We're being bugged.

[repeated question to Mumbles]
Where's Lips Manlis?
You have just said goodbye to oxygen. You silly, stupid cop. You refused me. I offer you the keys to a kingdom and you tell me you're an officer of the law? I AM THE LAW! ME!
Hello, Big Boy. I've brought your garbage.
Tracy.
We meet again, huh? Where's Lips?
This is a private club, coppa. You got a membership card?
You two married?
No. Would you like a broken arm?
[the Kid throws back the money on the table in disgust]
I don't like dames.
Good. Me neither.
Look what you did to your pretty tuxedo.
Big Boy, ain't we pals?
No pals in this business, Lips. You taught me that.
You're dirty, Lips. You need a bath.
Not "the bath". Not "the bath", Big boy, not "the bath"!
Thirty seconds, no more Dick! Thirty seconds, no more Dick!
I'm taking this bum out of the headlines... I'm rubbing him out!
Uh, wait. W-W-W-W-W-W-W-W-Wait.
[Dick Tracy turns toward Mumbles]

[speaking clearly]
88 Keys, the piano man set you up. Big Boy paid him to get you out of the way.
[first lines]

Gangland enforcers broke the arms of an elderly newsdealer this afternoon when he refused to share his week's receipts with them. Stacks of newspapers were tossed in the gutter as the thugs wrecked the business and made their getaway. Lunchtime crowds were paralyzed by the suddenness of the crime. Not a hand was raised in protest.
[last lines]
Well, what are you waitin' for? A nice, safe desk?
Tess?
[Tracy tosses her a wedding ring]
You're one in a million.
This is amazing, Tracy! What are you waitin' for? Come on, let's go! Come on, Metropolitan Bank! Come on, step on it! You know somethin', Tracy? I kind of like that dame.
I'm out.
It only works if we're all in.
Then it don't work.
You'll get Big Boy.
Big Boy's on the street and they want to stick me behind a desk?
They believe in you, Tracy. They think if you're chief of police, the city'll be safe.
Tess, there's about as much chance of me getting behind a desk as there is of me getting a new girlfriend.
